Certainly not to the pope, as he impudently presumas to boast, when he assumes this title to himself ; but to Christ, who exercises that office alone without vicar or successor, and resigns the honour to no other. For this priesthood, which was prefigured in the law, consists not only in preaching or doctrine, but in the propitiation of God, which Christ affected in his death, and in that intercession which he is now making with the Father.
